name: 4,4-bis(dimethylamino)benzophenone
Reason: 4,4-Bis(dimethylamino)benzophenone has a melting point that is influenced by several structural components. Starting with the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C, we have substantial structural components to consider. The two phenyl groups in this compound contribute to an increase in molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at approximately +30°C each. The dimethylamino group introduces additional rigidity, estimated at approximately +10°C. The methyl groups also contribute to the melting point due to their effect on the crystal lattice, estimated at approximately +5°C each. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, estimated at approximately +20°C. The piperidine ring introduces additional rigidity, estimated at approximately +10°C.
